Function.name: Identify
Function.desc: The activities in the Identify Function are foundational for effective use of the Framework. Understanding the business context, the resources that support critical functions, and the related cybersecurity risks enables an organization to focus and prioritize its efforts, consistent with its risk management strategy and business needs.

Category.title: ID.AM
Category.name: Asset Management
Category.desc: The data, personnel, devices, systems, and facilities that enable the organization to achieve business purposes are identified and managed consistent with their relative importance to organizational objectives and the organization’s risk strategy.

Subcategory.title: ID.AM-1
Subcategory.desc: Physical devices and systems within the organization are inventoried

Subcategory.title: ID.AM-2
Subcategory.desc: Software platforms and applications within the organization are inventoried

Subcategory.title: ID.AM-3
Subcategory.desc: Organizational communication and data flows are mapped

Subcategory.title: ID.AM-4
Subcategory.desc: External information systems are catalogued

Subcategory.title: ID.AM-5
Subcategory.desc: Resources (e.g., hardware, devices, data, time, personnel, and software) are prioritized based on their classification, criticality, and business value

Subcategory.title: ID.AM-6
Subcategory.desc: Cybersecurity roles and responsibilities for the entire workforce and third-party stakeholders (e.g., suppliers, customers, partners) are established

Category.title: ID.BE
Category.name: Business Environment
Category.desc: The organization’s mission, objectives, stakeholders, and activities are understood and prioritized; this information is used to inform cybersecurity roles, responsibilities, and risk management decisions.

Subcategory.title: ID.BE-1
Subcategory.desc: The organization’s role in the supply chain is identified and communicated

Subcategory.title: ID.BE-2
Subcategory.desc: The organization’s place in critical infrastructure and its industry sector is identified and communicated

Subcategory.title: ID.BE-3
Subcategory.desc: Priorities for organizational mission, objectives, and activities are established and communicated

Subcategory.title: ID.BE-4
Subcategory.desc: Dependencies and critical functions for delivery of critical services are established

Subcategory.title: ID.BE-5
Subcategory.desc: Resilience requirements to support delivery of critical services are established for all operating states (e.g. under duress/attack, during recovery, normal operations)

Category.title: ID.GV
Category.name: Governance
Category.desc: The policies, procedures, and processes to manage and monitor the organization’s regulatory, legal, risk, environmental, and operational requirements are understood and inform the management of cybersecurity risk.

Subcategory.title: ID.GV-1
Subcategory.desc: Organizational cybersecurity policy is established and communicated

Subcategory.title: ID.GV-2
Subcategory.desc: Cybersecurity roles and responsibilities are coordinated and aligned with internal roles and external partners

Subcategory.title: ID.GV-3
Subcategory.desc: Legal and regulatory requirements regarding cybersecurity, including privacy and civil liberties obligations, are understood and managed

Subcategory.title: ID.GV-4
Subcategory.desc: Governance and risk management processes address cybersecurity risks

Category.title: ID.RA
Category.name: Risk Assessment
Category.desc: The organization understands the cybersecurity risk to organizational operations (including mission, functions, image, or reputation), organizational assets, and individuals.

Subcategory.title: ID.RA-1
Subcategory.desc: Asset vulnerabilities are identified and documented

Subcategory.title: ID.RA-2
Subcategory.desc: Cyber threat intelligence is received from information sharing forums and sources

Subcategory.title: ID.RA-3
Subcategory.desc: Threats, both internal and external, are identified and documented

Subcategory.title: ID.RA-4
Subcategory.desc: Potential business impacts and likelihoods are identified

Subcategory.title: ID.RA-5
Subcategory.desc: Threats, vulnerabilities, likelihoods, and impacts are used to determine risk

Subcategory.title: ID.RA-6
Subcategory.desc: Risk responses are identified and prioritized

Category.title: ID.RM
Category.name: Risk Management Strategy
Category.desc: The organization’s priorities, constraints, risk tolerances, and assumptions are established and used to support operational risk decisions.

Subcategory.title: ID.RM-1
Subcategory.desc: Risk management processes are established, managed, and agreed to by organizational stakeholders

Subcategory.title: ID.RM-2
Subcategory.desc: Organizational risk tolerance is determined and clearly expressed

Subcategory.title: ID.RM-3
Subcategory.desc: The organization’s determination of risk tolerance is informed by its role in critical infrastructure and sector specific risk analysis

Category.title: ID.SC
Category.name: Supply Chain Risk Management
Category.desc: The organization’s priorities, constraints, risk tolerances, and assumptions are established and used to support risk decisions associated with managing supply chain risk. The organization has established and implemented the processes to identify, assess and manage supply chain risks.

Subcategory.title: ID.SC-1
Subcategory.desc: Cyber supply chain risk management processes are identified, established, assessed, managed, and agreed to by organizational stakeholders

Subcategory.title: ID.SC-2
Subcategory.desc: Suppliers and third party partners of information systems, components, and services are identified, prioritized, and assessed using a cyber supply chain risk assessment process

Subcategory.title: ID.SC-3
Subcategory.desc: Contracts with suppliers and third-party partners are used to implement appropriate measures designed to meet the objectives of an organization’s cyber-security program and Cyber Supply Chain Risk Management Plan.

Subcategory.title: ID.SC-4
Subcategory.desc: Suppliers and third-party partners are routinely assessed using audits, test results, or other forms of evaluations to confirm they are meeting their contractual obligations.

Subcategory.title: ID.SC-5
Subcategory.desc: Response and recovery planning and testing are conducted with suppliers and third-party providers

Function.name: Protect
Function.desc: The Protect Function supports the ability to limit or contain the impact of a potential cybersecurity event.

Category.title: PR.AC
Category.name: Identity Management, Authentication and Access Control
Category.desc: Access to physical and logical assets and associated facilities is limited to authorized users, processes, and devices, and is managed consistent with the assessed risk of unauthorized access to authorized activities and transactions.

Subcategory.title: PR.AC-1
Subcategory.desc: Identities and credentials are issued, managed, verified, revoked, and audited for authorized devices, users and processes

Subcategory.title: PR.AC-2
Subcategory.desc: Physical access to assets is managed and protected

Subcategory.title: PR.AC-3
Subcategory.desc: Remote access is managed

Subcategory.title: PR.AC-4
Subcategory.desc: Access permissions and authorizations are managed, incorporating the principles of least privilege and separation of duties

Subcategory.title: PR.AC-5
Subcategory.desc: Network integrity is protected (e.g., network segregation, network segmentation)

Subcategory.title: PR.AC-6
Subcategory.desc: Identities are proofed and bound to credentials and asserted in interactions

Subcategory.title: PR.AC-7
Subcategory.desc: Users, devices, and other assets are authenticated (e.g., single-factor, multi-factor) commensurate with the risk of the transaction (e.g., individuals’ security and privacy risks and other organizational risks)

Category.title: PR.AT
Category.name: Awareness and Training
Category.desc: The organization’s personnel and partners are provided cybersecurity awareness education and are trained to perform their cybersecurity-related duties and responsibilities consistent with related policies, procedures, and agreements.

Subcategory.title: PR.AT-1
Subcategory.desc: All users are informed and trained

Subcategory.title: PR.AT-2
Subcategory.desc: Privileged users understand their roles and responsibilities

Subcategory.title: PR.AT-3
Subcategory.desc: Third-party stakeholders (e.g., suppliers, customers, partners) understand their roles and responsibilities

Subcategory.title: PR.AT-4
Subcategory.desc: Senior executives understand their roles and responsibilities

Subcategory.title: PR.AT-5
Subcategory.desc: Physical and cybersecurity personnel understand their roles and responsibilities

Category.title: PR.DS
Category.name: Data Security
Category.desc: Information and records (data) are managed consistent with the organization’s risk strategy to protect the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of information.

Subcategory.title: PR.DS-1
Subcategory.desc: Data-at-rest is protected

Subcategory.title: PR.DS-2
Subcategory.desc: Data-in-transit is protected

Subcategory.title: PR.DS-3
Subcategory.desc: Assets are formally managed throughout removal, transfers, and disposition

Subcategory.title: PR.DS-4
Subcategory.desc: Adequate capacity to ensure availability is maintained

Subcategory.title: PR.DS-5
Subcategory.desc: Protections against data leaks are implemented

Subcategory.title: PR.DS-6
Subcategory.desc: Integrity checking mechanisms are used to verify software, firmware, and information integrity

Subcategory.title: PR.DS-7
Subcategory.desc: The development and testing environment(s) are separate from the production environment

Subcategory.title: PR.DS-8
Subcategory.desc: Integrity checking mechanisms are used to verify hardware integrity

Category.title: PR.IP
Category.name: Information Protection Processes and Procedures
Category.desc: Security policies (that address purpose, scope, roles, responsibilities, management commitment, and coordination among organizational entities), processes, and procedures are maintained and used to manage protection of information systems and assets.

Subcategory.title: PR.IP-1
Subcategory.desc: A baseline configuration of information technology/industrial control systems is created and maintained incorporating security principles (e.g. concept of least functionality)

Subcategory.title: PR.IP-2
Subcategory.desc: A System Development Life Cycle to manage systems is implemented

Subcategory.title: PR.IP-3
Subcategory.desc: Configuration change control processes are in place

Subcategory.title: PR.IP-4
Subcategory.desc: Backups of information are conducted, maintained, and tested

Subcategory.title: PR.IP-5
Subcategory.desc: Policy and regulations regarding the physical operating environment for organizational assets are met

Subcategory.title: PR.IP-6
Subcategory.desc: Data is destroyed according to policy

Subcategory.title: PR.IP-7
Subcategory.desc: Protection processes are improved

Subcategory.title: PR.IP-8
Subcategory.desc: Effectiveness of protection technologies is shared

Subcategory.title: PR.IP-9
Subcategory.desc: Response plans (Incident Response and Business Continuity) and recovery plans (Incident Recovery and Disaster Recovery) are in place and managed

Subcategory.title: PR.IP-10
Subcategory.desc: Response and recovery plans are tested

Subcategory.title: PR.IP-11
Subcategory.desc: Cybersecurity is included in human resources practices (e.g., deprovisioning, personnel screening)

Subcategory.title: PR.IP-12
Subcategory.desc: A vulnerability management plan is developed and implemented

Category.title: PR.MA
Category.name: Maintenance
Category.desc: Maintenance and repairs of industrial control and information system components are performed consistent with policies and procedures.

Subcategory.title: PR.MA-1
Subcategory.desc: Maintenance and repair of organizational assets are performed and logged, with approved and controlled tools

Subcategory.title: PR.MA-2
Subcategory.desc: Remote maintenance of organizational assets is approved, logged, and performed in a manner that prevents unauthorized access

Category.title: PR.PT
Category.name: Protective Technology
Category.desc: Technical security solutions are managed to ensure the security and resilience of systems and assets, consistent with related policies, procedures, and agreements.

Subcategory.title: PR.PT-1
Subcategory.desc: Audit/log records are determined, documented, implemented, and reviewed in accordance with policy

Subcategory.title: PR.PT-2
Subcategory.desc: Removable media is protected and its use restricted according to policy

Subcategory.title: PR.PT-3
Subcategory.desc: The principle of least functionality is incorporated by configuring systems to provide only essential capabilities

Subcategory.title: PR.PT-4
Subcategory.desc: Communications and control networks are protected

Subcategory.title: PR.PT-5
Subcategory.desc: Mechanisms (e.g., failsafe, load balancing, hot swap) are implemented to achieve resilience requirements in normal and adverse situations

Function.name: Detect
Function.desc: The Detect Function enables timely discovery of cybersecurity events.

Category.title: DE.AE
Category.name: Anomalies and Events
Category.desc: Anomalous activity is detected and the potential impact of events is understood.

Subcategory.title: DE.AE-1
Subcategory.desc: A baseline of network operations and expected data flows for users and systems is established and managed

Subcategory.title: DE.AE-2
Subcategory.desc: Detected events are analyzed to understand attack targets and methods

Subcategory.title: DE.AE-3
Subcategory.desc: Event data are collected and correlated from multiple sources and sensors

Subcategory.title: DE.AE-4
Subcategory.desc: Impact of events is determined

Subcategory.title: DE.AE-5
Subcategory.desc: Incident alert thresholds are established

Category.title: DE.CM
Category.name: Security Continuous Monitoring
Category.desc: The information system and assets are monitored to identify cybersecurity events and verify the effectiveness of protective measures.

Subcategory.title: DE.CM-1
Subcategory.desc: The network is monitored to detect potential cybersecurity events

Subcategory.title: DE.CM-2
Subcategory.desc: The physical environment is monitored to detect potential cybersecurity events

Subcategory.title: DE.CM-3
Subcategory.desc: Personnel activity is monitored to detect potential cybersecurity events

Subcategory.title: DE.CM-4
Subcategory.desc: Malicious code is detected

Subcategory.title: DE.CM-5
Subcategory.desc: Unauthorized mobile code is detected

Subcategory.title: DE.CM-6
Subcategory.desc: External service provider activity is monitored to detect potential cybersecurity events

Subcategory.title: DE.CM-7
Subcategory.desc: Monitoring for unauthorized personnel, connections, devices, and software is performed

Subcategory.title: DE.CM-8
Subcategory.desc: Vulnerability scans are performed

Category.title: DE.DP
Category.name: Detection Processes
Category.desc: Detection processes and procedures are maintained and tested to ensure awareness of anomalous events.

Subcategory.title: DE.DP-1
Subcategory.desc: Roles and responsibilities for detection are well defined to ensure accountability

Subcategory.title: DE.DP-2
Subcategory.desc: Detection activities comply with all applicable requirements

Subcategory.title: DE.DP-3
Subcategory.desc: Detection processes are tested

Subcategory.title: DE.DP-4
Subcategory.desc: Event detection information is communicated

Subcategory.title: DE.DP-5
Subcategory.desc: Detection processes are continuously improved

Function.name: Respond
Function.desc: The Respond Function supports the ability to contain the impact of a potential cybersecurity event.

Category.title: RS.RP
Category.name: Response Planning
Category.desc: Response processes and procedures are executed and maintained, to ensure response to detected cybersecurity incidents.

Subcategory.title: RS.RP-1
Subcategory.desc: Response plan is executed during or after an incident

Category.title: RS.CO
Category.name: Communications
Category.desc: Response activities are coordinated with internal and external stakeholders (e.g. external support from law enforcement agencies).

Subcategory.title: RS.CO-1
Subcategory.desc: Personnel know their roles and order of operations when a response is needed

Subcategory.title: RS.CO-2
Subcategory.desc: Incidents are reported consistent with established criteria

Subcategory.title: RS.CO-3
Subcategory.desc: Information is shared consistent with response plans

Subcategory.title: RS.CO-4
Subcategory.desc: Coordination with stakeholders occurs consistent with response plans

Subcategory.title: RS.CO-5
Subcategory.desc: Voluntary information sharing occurs with external stakeholders to achieve broader cybersecurity situational awareness

Category.title: RS.AN
Category.name: Analysis
Category.desc: Analysis is conducted to ensure effective response and support recovery activities.

Subcategory.title: RS.AN-1
Subcategory.desc: Notifications from detection systems are investigated

Subcategory.title: RS.AN-2
Subcategory.desc: The impact of the incident is understood

Subcategory.title: RS.AN-3
Subcategory.desc: Forensics are performed

Subcategory.title: RS.AN-4
Subcategory.desc: Incidents are categorized consistent with response plans

Subcategory.title: RS.AN-5
Subcategory.desc: Processes are established to receive, analyze and respond to vulnerabilities disclosed to the organization from internal and external sources (e.g. internal testing, security bulletins, or security researchers)

Category.title: RS.MI
Category.name: Mitigation
Category.desc: Activities are performed to prevent expansion of an event, mitigate its effects, and resolve the incident.

Subcategory.title: RS.MI-1
Subcategory.desc: Incidents are contained

Subcategory.title: RS.MI-2
Subcategory.desc: Incidents are mitigated

Subcategory.title: RS.MI-3
Subcategory.desc: Newly identified vulnerabilities are mitigated or documented as accepted risks

Category.title: RS.IM
Category.name: Improvements
Category.desc: Organizational response activities are improved by incorporating lessons learned from current and previous detection/response activities.

Subcategory.title: RS.IM-1
Subcategory.desc: Response plans incorporate lessons learned

Subcategory.title: RS.IM-2
Subcategory.desc: Response strategies are updated

Function.name: Recover
Function.desc: The Recover Function supports timely recovery to normal operations to reduce the impact from a cybersecurity event.

Category.title: RC.RP
Category.name: Recovery Planning
Category.desc: Recovery processes and procedures are executed and maintained to ensure restoration of systems or assets affected by cybersecurity incidents.

Subcategory.title: RC.RP-1
Subcategory.desc: Recovery plan is executed during or after a cybersecurity incident

Category.title: RC.IM
Category.name: Improvements
Category.desc: Recovery planning and processes are improved by incorporating lessons learned into future activities.

Subcategory.title: RC.IM-1
Subcategory.desc: Recovery plans incorporate lessons learned

Subcategory.title: RC.IM-2
Subcategory.desc: Recovery strategies are updated

Category.title: RC.CO
Category.name: Communications
Category.desc: Restoration activities are coordinated with internal and external parties (e.g. coordinating centers, Internet Service Providers, owners of attacking systems, victims, other CSIRTs, and vendors).

Subcategory.title: RC.CO-1
Subcategory.desc: Public relations are managed

Subcategory.title: RC.CO-2
Subcategory.desc: Reputation is repaired after an incident

Subcategory.title: RC.CO-3
Subcategory.desc: Recovery activities are communicated to internal and external stakeholders as well as executive and management teams
